se control and prevention (CDC) 
recommends a daily intake of 400 micrograms of folic acid 
before conception and during the first trimester, increasing 
to 600 micrograms during pregnancy (CDC, 2020). Food 
sources rich in folic acid include leafy green vegetables, 
citrus fruits, beans, and fortified cereals.
